result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristi L Sorenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristi L Sorenson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristi L Sorenson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $343  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per count. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not direct any acts or threats of violence against Joshua S.
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward T.L.D.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Court modifies bond condition upon agreement of counsel: No contact modified to: Defendant is not to direct any acts or threats of violence against Joshua S.  All other conditions remain.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Eisenberg.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
